001
002package com.commercetools.api.models.common;
003
004import static com.commercetools.api.models.InternalUtils.*;
005import static java.lang.String.format;
006import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
007
008import java.util.*;
009import java.util.function.BiFunction;
010import java.util.function.Function;
011import java.util.stream.Collector;
012import java.util.stream.Collectors;
013import java.util.stream.Stream;
014import java.util.stream.StreamSupport;
015
016import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
017import javax.annotation.Nullable;
018import javax.validation.constraints.NotNull;
019
020import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.*;
021import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference;
022import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.*;
023
024/**
025 * A localized string is a object where the keys are {@link Locale}s (HTTP API: ISO language tags),
026 * and the values are the corresponding strings used for that language.
027 *
028 * {@include.example com.commercetools.LocalizedStringTest#defaultUseCases()}
029 */
030@JsonDeserialize(as = LocalizedStringImpl.class)
031public interface LocalizedString {
032
033    @NotNull
034    @JsonAnyGetter
035    public Map<String, String> values();
036
037    @JsonAnySetter
038    public void setValue(String key, String value);
039
040    public static LocalizedString of() {
041        return new LocalizedStringImpl();
042    }
043
044    public static LocalizedString of(final LocalizedString template) {
045        LocalizedStringImpl instance = new LocalizedStringImpl();
046        return instance;
047    }
048
049    public static LocalizedStringBuilder builder() {
050        return LocalizedStringBuilder.of();
051    }
052
053    public static LocalizedStringBuilder builder(final LocalizedString template) {
054        return LocalizedStringBuilder.of(template);
055    }
056
057    default <T> T withLocalizedString(Function<LocalizedString, T> helper) {
058        return helper.apply(this);
059    }
060
061    @NotNull
062    @JsonIgnore
063    default public Map<Locale, String> localeValues() {
064        return values().entrySet().stream().collect(Collectors.toMap(e -> new Locale(e.getKey()), Map.Entry::getValue));
065    }
066
067    /**
068     * Creates an instance without any value.
069     *
070     * @return instance without any value
071     */
072    public static LocalizedString empty() {
073        return of();
074    }
075
076    /**
077     * Creates an instance with one locale translation pair.
078     *
079     * @param locale the locale for the one translation
080     * @param value the translation for the specified locale
081     * @return translation for one language
082     */
083    @JsonIgnore
084    public static LocalizedString of(final Locale locale, final String value) {
085        requireNonNull(locale);
086        requireNonNull(value);
087        return ofStringToStringMap(mapOf(locale.toLanguageTag(), value));
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Creates an instance for two different locales.
092     *
093     * @param locale1 the first locale
094     * @param value1 the translation corresponding to {@code locale1}
095     * @param locale2 the second locale which differs from {@code locale1}
096     * @param value2 the translation corresponding to {@code locale2}
097     * @return new instance for two key value pairs
098     */
099    @JsonIgnore
100    public static LocalizedString of(final Locale locale1, final String value1, final Locale locale2,
101            final String value2) {
102        return ofStringToStringMap(mapOf(locale1.toLanguageTag(), value1, locale2.toLanguageTag(), value2));
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Creates an instance by supplying a map of {@link Locale} and {@link String}. Changes to the map won't affect the instance.
107     *
108     * @param translations the key value pairs for the translation
109     * @return a new instance which has the same key value pairs as {@code translation} at creation time
110     */
111    @JsonIgnore
112    public static LocalizedString of(final Map<Locale, String> translations) {
113        requireNonNull(translations);
114        return LocalizedString.ofStringToStringMap(translations.entrySet()
115                .stream()
116                .collect(Collectors.toMap(e -> e.getKey().toLanguageTag(), Map.Entry::getValue)));
117    }
118
119    /**
120     * Creates an instance by supplying a map of {@link String} the language tag and {@link String}. Changes to the map won't affect the instance.
121     *
122     * @param translations the key value pairs for the translation
123     * @return a new instance which has the same key value pairs as {@code translation} at creation time
124     */
125    @JsonIgnore
126    public static LocalizedString ofStringToStringMap(final Map<String, String> translations) {
127        requireNonNull(translations);
128        return LocalizedStringBuilder.of().values(translations).build();
129    }
130
131    /**
132     * Creates a new {@link LocalizedString} containing the given entries and the new one.
133     * It is not allowed to override existing entries.
134     *
135     * @param locale the additional locale of the new entry
136     * @param value the value for the <code>locale</code>
137     * @return a LocalizedString containing this data and the from the parameters.
138     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if duplicate locales are provided
139     */
140    default public LocalizedString plus(final Locale locale, final String value) {
141        if (values().containsKey(locale.toLanguageTag())) {
142            throw new IllegalArgumentException(format("Duplicate keys (%s) for map creation.", locale));
143        }
144        final Map<String, String> newMap = new HashMap<>(values());
145        newMap.put(locale.toLanguageTag(), value);
146        return LocalizedStringBuilder.of().values(newMap).build();
147    }
148
149    /**
150     * Searches the translation for an exact locale and returning the result in an {@link Optional}.
151     *
152     * @param locale the locale which should be searched
153     * @return A filled optional with the translation belonging to {@code locale} or an empty optional if the locale is not present.
154     */
155    @Nonnull
156    default public Optional<String> find(final Locale locale) {
157        return Optional.ofNullable(get(locale));
158    }
159
160    /**
161     * Searches the translation for an exact locale by using {@code null} in the case the locale ist not present.
162     *
163     * @param locale the locale which should be searched
164     * @return the translation belonging to {@code locale} or null if the locale is not present.
165     */
166    @Nullable
167    default public String get(final Locale locale) {
168        return values().get(locale.toLanguageTag());
169    }
170
171    /**
172     * Searches the translation for a locale specified in IETF BCP 47 by language tag string.
173     * If the specified language tag contains any ill-formed subtags, the first such subtag and all following subtags are ignored.
174     *
175     * @param languageTag the IETF language tag corresponding to an {@code Locale}
176     * @return the translation belonging to {@code languageTag} or {@code null} if the locale is not present.
177     */
178    @Nullable
179    default public String get(final String languageTag) {
180        final Locale locale = Locale.forLanguageTag(languageTag);
181        return get(locale);
182    }
183
184    /**
185     * Searches the translation for some exact locales in the order they appear and returning the result in an {@link Optional}.
186     *
187     * @param locales the locale which should be searched, the first exact match wins
188     * @return A filled optional with the translation belonging to one of the {@code locales} or an empty optional if none of the locales is not present.
189     */
190    @Nonnull
191    default public Optional<String> find(final Iterable<Locale> locales) {
192        final Optional<Locale> firstFoundLocale = toStream(locales)
193                .filter(locale -> values().containsKey(locale.toLanguageTag()))
194                .findFirst();
195        return firstFoundLocale.map(foundLocale -> get(foundLocale.toLanguageTag()));
196    }
197
198    /**
199     * Searches the translation for some exact locales in the order they appear and using null as result if no match could be found.
200     *
201     * @param locales the locale which should be searched, the first exact match wins
202     * @return the translation belonging to one of the {@code locales} or null if none of the locales is not present.
203     */
204    @Nullable
205    default public String get(final Iterable<Locale> locales) {
206        return find(locales).orElse(null);
207    }
208
209    /**
210     * Searches a translation which matches a locale in {@code locales} and uses language fallbackes.
211     * If locales which countries are used then the algorithm searches also for the pure language locale.
212     * So if "en_US" could not be found then "en" will be tried.
213     *
214     * @param locales the locales to try out
215     * @return a translation matching one of the locales or null
216     */
217    @Nullable
218    @JsonIgnore
219    default public String getTranslation(final Iterable<Locale> locales) {
220        return StreamSupport.stream(locales.spliterator(), false).map(localeToFind -> {
221            String match = get(localeToFind);
222            if (match == null) {
223                final Locale pureLanguageLocale = new Locale(localeToFind.getLanguage());
224                match = get(pureLanguageLocale);
225            }
226            return match;
227        }).filter(Objects::nonNull).findFirst().orElse(null);
228    }
229
230    /**
231     * Creates a new instance where each translation value is transformed with {@code function}.
232     *
233     * @param function transforms a value for a locale into a new value
234     * @return a new {@link LocalizedString} which consist all elements for this transformed with {@code function}
235     */
236    default public LocalizedString mapValue(final BiFunction<Locale, String, String> function) {
237        return stream().map(entry -> {
238            final String newValue = function.apply(entry.getLocale(), entry.getValue());
239            return LocalizedStringEntry.of(entry.getLocale(), newValue);
240        }).collect(streamCollector());
241    }
242
243    /**
244     * Creates a new Stream of entries.
245     *
246     * @return stream of all entries
247     */
248    default public Stream<LocalizedStringEntry> stream() {
249        return values().entrySet().stream().map(entry -> LocalizedStringEntry.of(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue()));
250    }
251
252    /**
253     * Collector to collect a stream of {@link LocalizedStringEntry}s to one {@link LocalizedString}.
254     *
255     * @return collector
256     */
257    public static Collector<LocalizedStringEntry, ?, LocalizedString> streamCollector() {
258        final Collector<LocalizedStringEntry, Map<String, String>, LocalizedString> result = Collector.of(
259            HashMap::new, (Map<String, String> tmpMap, LocalizedStringEntry entry) -> tmpMap
260                    .put(entry.getLocale().toLanguageTag(), entry.getValue()),
261            (Map<String, String> left, Map<String, String> right) -> {
262                left.putAll(right);
263                return left;
264            }, (Map<String, String> entryMap) -> LocalizedStringBuilder.of().values(entryMap).build());
265        return result;
266    }
267
268    /**
269     * Creates a new {@link LocalizedString} where all translations are slugified (remove whitespace, etc.).
270     *
271     * @return new instance
272     */
273    default public LocalizedString slugified() {
274        return mapValue((locale, value) -> slugify(value));
275    }
276
277    /**
278     * Creates a new {@link LocalizedString} where all translations are slugified (remove whitespace, etc.) and a random supplement is added.
279     * This slugify methods appends a random string for a little uniqueness.
280     *
281     * @return new instance
282     */
283    default public LocalizedString slugifiedUnique() {
284        return mapValue((locale, value) -> slugifyUnique(value));
285    }
286
287    /**
288     * Returns all locales included in this instance.
289     *
290     * @return locales
291     */
292    @JsonIgnore
293    @Nonnull
294    default public Set<Locale> getLocales() {
295        return localeValues().keySet();
296    }
297
298    /**
299     * Delivers an immutable map of the translation.
300     *
301     * @return the key-value pairs for the translation
302     */
303    @JsonIgnore
304    default Map<Locale, String> getTranslations() {
305        return immutableCopyOf(localeValues());
306    }
307
308    default void set(final Locale languageTag, final String value) {
309        setValue(languageTag.toLanguageTag(), value);
310    }
311
312    /**
313     * Creates a container which contains the full Java type information to deserialize this class from JSON.
314     *
315     * @return type reference
316     */
317    public static TypeReference<LocalizedString> typeReference() {
318        return new TypeReference<LocalizedString>() {
319            @Override
320            public String toString() {
321                return "TypeReference<LocalizedString>";
322            }
323        };
324    }
325
326    public static LocalizedString ofEnglish(final String translationForEnglish) {
327        requireNonNull(translationForEnglish);
328        return of(Locale.ENGLISH, translationForEnglish);
329    }
330}
